  <!-- /tal:keyinfo -->

  <!-- tal:degreeinfo -->
  <section class="copy__section copy__section--taught">
    <h2 class="copy__heading collapse__header">About this degree</h2>
    <div class="collapse__content">
      <p ><p>The core module develops a close reading of works by writers of the period, while the optional modules offer the opportunity to analyse some of the technologies, media, philosophical perspectives and art forms whose development during the 20th century has made itself felt in modernist and postmodernist writing.</p></p>      <p >Students undertake modules to the value of 180 credits.</p>      <p ><p>The programme consists of one core module (60 credits), three optional modules (60 credits) and a research dissertation (60 credits).</p></p>                            </div>

    <div class="clearfix">
      <div class="copy__column dc1-dc2 modulelist">
        <h4 >Core module</h4>                          <ul>
                          <li><b>Authors</b> (including Gustave Flaubert, D.H. Lawrence; T.S. Eliot, James Joyce, Virginia Woolf, Ralph Ellison, Alfred Hitchcock, Sylvia Plath, Toni Morrison, Alan Hollinghurst, David Foster Wallace). Please see <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/ma-issues-in-modern-culture">UCL English website</a> for more.</li>
                      </ul>
        
        
        <h4 >Optional modules</h4>
        
                  <ul>
                          <li>The majority of students elect to take <b>Contexts</b>, which explores the relationship between modern culture and the city from the 1860s to the present day, and may include the following topics:</li>
                          <li>The Body and Technology</li>
                          <li>Catastrophe and the City</li>
                          <li>Psychogeography</li>
                          <li>Class and the City</li>
                          <li>The Harlem Renaissance</li>
                          <li>Hollywood Fiction</li>
                          <li>Queer Fictions and the City</li>
                          <li>Students then take further optional modules. Options available change every year, but in recent years have included:</li>
                          <li>Contemporary Poetry</li>
                          <li>American Counter-Culture</li>
                          <li>21st Century Fiction</li>
                          <li>Modernism, Sex and Redemption</li>
                          <li>Afrofuturism</li>
                          <li>Inventions of Cinema</li>
                          <li>Marxist Aesthetics in the 20th Century</li>
                          <li>Cultures of Chance: Accident, Error, and Catastrophe in post-1945 Literature and Culture</li>
                          <li>Global Anglophone Literature</li>
                      </ul>
        
                
      </div>

      <div class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
        <h4>Dissertation/report</h4>
        <p ><p>All MA students undertake an independent research project which culminates in a dissertation of 12,000 words.</p></p>
        <h4>Teaching and learning</h4>
        <p ><p>Each module is taught through a weekly seminar. Assessment is through take-home written examination, essays and the research dissertation.</p></p>
        
              </div>
    </div>

        
          <div>
        Further information on modules and degree structure is available on the department website:
        <a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/ma-issues-in-modern-culture">English: Issues in Modern Culture MA</a>
      </div>
      </section>
  <!-- /tal:degreeinfo -->

  <!-- tal:overview -->
  <!-- /tal:overview -->

  <!-- tal:funding -->
  <section class="copy__section copy__section--taught collapse">
    <h2 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Funding</h2>
    <div class="collapse__content">
            
      
      <p >For a comprehensive list of the funding opportunities available at UCL, including funding relevant to your nationality, please visit the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding website</a>.</p>
          </div>
  </section>
  <!-- /tal:funding -->

  <!-- tal:careers -->
  <section class="copy__section copy__section--taught">
    <h2 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h2>
    <div class="collapse__content">
            <p ><p>The programme is an ideal preliminary stage to doctoral research and candidates who obtain the MA and have found a promising subject requiring further study are encouraged to apply to the UCL MPhil/PhD programme.</p></p>      <div class="clearfix">
                  <div class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
            <h4>Top career destinations for this degree</h4>
            <ul>
                              <li>
                                      <span >Assistant Editor, Bloomsbury Publishing</span>                                  </li>
                            <li>
                                      <span >Commissioning Editor, CIPD (Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development)</span>                                  </li>
                            <li>
                                      <span >Copywriter / Strategist, Zenith Optimedia</span>                                  </li>
                            <li>
                                      <span >Researcher, AMVBBDO</span>                                  </li>
                            <li>
                                      <span >Copywriter, Freelance Copywriter</span>                                  </li>
                        </ul>
          </div>
        
              </div>

      
              <div class="clearfix">
          <div class="copy__column">
            <p class="small text-muted">Careers data is taken from the ‘Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education’ survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2012–2014 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>          </div>
        </div>
          </div>
  </section>
  <!-- /tal:careers -->

  <!-- tal:reviewsandwhy -->
  <section class="copy__section copy__section--taught">
    <h2 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Why study this degree at UCL?</h2>
    <div class="collapse__content">
              <p><p>UCL English has an outstanding record for research; many staff publish in mainstream as well as academic media: some are regular reviewers for newspapers and periodicals.</p></p>
              <p><p>Excellent facilities are provided by the UCL library. It has several important holdings including the James Joyce Collection and the George Orwell Archive.</p></p>
              <p><p>Our graduate students have access to an incomparable range of archives and libraries, including Senate House Library and the British Library, both of which are nearby.</p></p>
      
      
              <p><strong>Department:</strong> <a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/english" class="clicktracker department--why__ucl">English Language & Literature</a></p>
      
              <p>
          <strong>Student / staff numbers</strong>
                      &rsaquo; 33 staff
                          including 2 postdocs
                                            &rsaquo; 67 taught students
                                &rsaquo; 49 research students
                    <br />
          Staff/student numbers information correct as of 1 August 2017.        </p>
      
              <h4>Research Excellence Framework (REF)</h4>
                <p >The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework</a>, or REF, is the system for assessing the quality of research in UK higher education institutions. The 2014 REF was carried out by the UK's higher education funding bodies, and the results used to allocate research funding from 2015/16.</p>                  <p>The following REF score was awarded to the department: English Language & Literature<br />85% rated 4* (&#145;world-leading&#146;) or 3* (&#145;internationally excellent&#146;)</p>
                <p >Learn more about the scope of UCL's research, and browse case studies, on our <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/impact/">Research Impact website</a>.</p>      
              <h4>What our students and staff say</h4>
                  <div class="box--alt tagged">
            <div class="tag tag--taught"><span class="tag__heading">Staff view</span></div>

            <div class="media">
              <div class="media__body">
                <blockquote>
                  <p>&quot;UCL English is a world-class department with a reputation both for prioritising the pedagogic relationship between academic staff and students and for nurturing original literary-historical scholarship. My research over the last few years has focused on the history and representation of metropolitan cities, especially at night. The various modules are terrifically rewarding, especially as the department encourages thinking outside narrow scholarly specialisms.&quot;</p>
                  <h3 class="as-h5">
                    <cite> Matthew Beaumont</cite>
                  </h3>
                  <small>
                    English: Issues in Modern Culture                                      </small>
                  <br />
                  <small >UCL English Language and Literature</small>                </blockquote>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
                  </div>
  </section>
  <!-- /tal:reviewsandwhy -->

  <!-- tal:application -->
      <section class="copy__section copy__section--taught">
      <h2 id="application" class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h2>

      <div class="collapse__content">
        <h3>Applications</h3>

                  <p >Students are advised to apply as early as possible due to competition for places. Those applying for scholarship funding (particularly overseas applicants) should take note of application deadlines.</p>                
        
        <div class="clearfix">
          <div class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                          <h4>Who can apply?</h4>
              <p ><p>The programme is particularly suitable for graduates with a first degree in English, although applicants holding a degree in another subject will be considered. The programme gives students a thorough grounding in the skills needed for independent research, and is an ideal foundation for further academic study in this field.</p></p>                        <div>
              <h4>Application deadlines</h4>
                              <dl class="list--defined">
                                                            <dt >All applicants</dt>                      <dd >27 July 2018</dd>                                                                                                                                  </dl>
                                                                    </div>
            <br><p>For more information see our <a href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Applications</a> page.</p>
            <a class="clicktracker call-to-action applytaught" href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Apply now</a>
          </div>
                      <div class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
              <h4>What are we looking for?</h4>
              <p ><p>When we assess your application we would like to learn:</p><ul>

<li>why you want to study English: Issues in Modern Culture at graduate level</li> <li>why you want to study English: Issues in Modern Culture at UCL</li> <li>what particularly attracts you to this programme</li> 

</ul><p>Together with essential academic requirements, the personal statement is your opportunity to illustrate whether your reasons for applying to this programme match what the programme will deliver.</p></p>                          </div>
                  </div>
        <!-- contacts go here -->
                    <div class="clearfix">
                <h3>Contact information</h3>
                                                        <div class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                        <ul class="unset-list">
                                                            <li>
                                    <span class="icon icon-user" aria-hidden="true"></span>
                                    Dr Clare Stainthorp                                                                    </li>
                                                                                        <li>
                                    <span class="icon icon-mail" aria-hidden="true"></span>
                                    <a class="force-wrap clicktracker departmentemailtaught" href="mailto:c.stainthorp@ucl.ac.uk">c.stainthorp@ucl.ac.uk</a>                                </li>
                                                                                        <li class="space-after">
                                    <span class="icon icon-phone" aria-hidden="true"></span>
                                    <!-- this tel: href should be hidden from desktops in the client side with JS or CSS -->
                                    <a href="tel:+44 (0)20 7679 7122 ">+44 (0)20 7679 7122 </a>                                </li>
                                                    </ul>
                    </div>
                                            </div>
                            <div class="clearfix">
                <ul class="unset-list">
                    <li>
                    <span class="icon icon-online" aria-hidden="true"></span>
                    <a class="clicktracker departmentemailtaught" href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/english">English Language & Literature</a>                    </li>
                </ul>
            </div>
                <!-- end contacts here -->
      </div>
    </section>

            <p class="zero-bottom last-modified">
            Page last modified on 12 October 2017 by UCL Student Recruitment Marketing
        </p>
        <!-- /tal:application -->

                                <div class="hero__content">

                                        <!-- Start special PS intro --> 

    

    
        
                                    
            <h1 class="as-h5">
                <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/taught">Taught</a>
            </h1>
            <h1 class="hero__title">English Linguistics MA</h1>
            
                <ul class="tags hero__tags">
                    <li>

            <div id="main" class="clearfix">
                
                    
                    
                        <ul class="nav nav--inline nav--pull mobile-hide">
                            <li class="nav--inline__li nav__li--prev">
                                <span class="icon icon-left-open"></span>
                                <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/taught">Taught degrees</a>
                            </li>
                            <li class="nav--inline__li nav--inline__li--icon">
                                <a href="#application" data-scroll="">Application and next steps</a>

                        <section class="block block--full-width block--highlight">
                            <article class="layout__content copy">
                                <!-- Start Silva content --> 

    
        

            

            
                
        
      <!-- tal:standfirst -->
  <p class="copy__intro">The English Linguistics MA provides students with the theoretical and practical knowledge needed to describe modern English, together with appropriate training in academic writing, linguistic argumentation and research methods. Students have access to the Survey of English Usage, an unparalleled resource for research into grammatical repertoire.</p>  <!-- /tal:standfirst -->

  <!-- tal:keyinfo -->
  <section class="copy__section copy__section--key__information copy__section--taught">
    <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight">
      <h2 class="copy__heading">Key information</h2>
      <div class="clearfix">

                
        <div class="clearfix">
          <h4>Programme starts</h4>
          <p>September 2018</p>
        </div>

        <div class="copy__column dl1-dl2">
          <h4>Modes and duration</h4>
                        <div>
                <strong>Full time:</strong> 1 year              </div>
                                  <div>
                <strong>Part time:</strong> 2 years              </div>
                                                                      </div>

        <div class="copy__column dl3">
          <h4>Tuition fees (2018/19)</h4>

          <dl class="list--defined">
            <dt>UK/EU:</dt>
            <dd>
                              <span>&#163;10,140 (FT)</span>
                                            <span>&#163;5,120 (PT)</span>
                          </dd>

            <dt>Overseas:</dt>
            <dd>
                              <span>&#163;21,160 (FT)</span>
                                            <span>&#163;10,740 (PT)</span>
                          </dd>
          </dl>
        </div>

                                          <div class="copy__column dl4-dl5">
            <h4>Application dates</h4>
                                          <div>
                  <div><strong>All applicants</strong></div>
                                      <div>Open: 16 October 2017</div>
                                                        <div>Close: 27 July 2018</div>
                                  </div>
                                                                                                                </div>
              </div>
                  <div>
            <p>
              <b>Note on fees:</b>
                              The tuition fees shown are for the year indicated above. Fees for subsequent years may increase or otherwise vary. Further information on fee status, fee increases and the fee schedule can be viewed on the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/students/fees">UCL Current Students website</a>.                                        </p>
          </div>
        
                
                  <div>
                                      <div>
                <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury              </div>
                      </div>
        
        <hr>

        <div class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
           <!-- CHECK FOR teaching-training IN SITE? - see isTeacherTraining -->
            <h4>Entry requirements</h4>
            <p>Applications are welcome from candidates who have at least a second-class Bachelor's degree in English Language or Literature from a UK university, or an overseas qualification of an equivalent standard.<br><br>Some prior knowledge of English language studies (specifically English grammar) is expected for the programme.</p>
                    
          <h4>English language requirements</h4>
          <p >If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency.</p>          <p>The English language level for this programme is: <strong >Good</strong></p>
          <p >Further information can be found on our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/international/english-requirements">English language requirements</a> page.</p>        </div>

        <div class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
          <h4>International students</h4>
          <p >Country-specific information, including details of when UCL representatives are visiting your part of the world, can be obtained from the <a class="clicktracker international" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international">International Students website</a>.</p>
          <!-- tal:visa -->
                    <!-- /tal:visa -->

          <p>International applicants can find out the equivalent qualification for their country by selecting from the list below.</p>

  <!-- /tal:keyinfo -->

  <!-- tal:degreeinfo -->
  <section class="copy__section copy__section--taught">
    <h2 class="copy__heading collapse__header">About this degree</h2>
    <div class="collapse__content">
      <p ><p>The MA introduces students to the core areas of the study of English Linguistics, including morphology, syntax, phonetics, phonology and pragmatics. The programme trains students to use library OPACS, specialised websites, discussion lists, and databases, among them the ICE-GB corpus, based at the Survey of English Usage in UCL English.</p></p>      <p >Students undertake modules to the value of 180 credits.</p>      <p ><p>The programme consists of three core components (90 credits), two optional modules (30 credits) and a research dissertation (60 credits).</p></p>                            </div>

    <div class="clearfix">
      <div class="copy__column dc1-dc2 modulelist">
        <h4 >Core modules</h4>                          <ul>
                          <li>English Grammar and Methodology</li>
                          <li><b>Either</b> English Corpus Linguistics <b>or</b> English Language in Use</li>
                          <li>Research Methodology</li>
                      </ul>
        
        
        <h4 >Optional modules</h4>
        <div ><p>Students take <strong>two</strong>&nbsp;optional modules. Different options are offered each year and have included:</p></div>
                  <ul>
                          <li>English Words</li>
                          <li>History of the English Language</li>
                          <li>Literary Linguistics</li>
                          <li>Phonetics and Phonology of English</li>
                      </ul>
        
                
      </div>

      <div class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
        <h4>Dissertation/report</h4>
        <p ><p>All MA Students undertake an independent research project which culminates in a dissertation of 10,000 words. Students have access to the Survey of English Usage for this project.</p></p>
        <h4>Teaching and learning</h4>
        <p ><p>The programme is taught through seminars and individual tutorials. Student assessment is through a portfolio of essays (two 2,000-word essays on English linguistics), two three-hour written papers and the dissertation.&nbsp;</p></p>
        
              </div>
    </div>

        
          <div>
        Further information on modules and degree structure is available on the department website:
        <a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/ma-english-linguistics">English Linguistics MA</a>
      </div>
      </section>
  <!-- /tal:degreeinfo -->

  <!-- tal:overview -->
  <!-- /tal:overview -->

  <!-- tal:funding -->
  <section class="copy__section copy__section--taught collapse">
    <h2 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Funding</h2>
    <div class="collapse__content">
            
      
      <p >For a comprehensive list of the funding opportunities available at UCL, including funding relevant to your nationality, please visit the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding website</a>.</p>
          </div>
  </section>
  <!-- /tal:funding -->

  <!-- tal:careers -->
  <section class="copy__section copy__section--taught">
    <h2 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h2>
    <div class="collapse__content">
            <p ><p>The programme provides an ideal foundation for those wishing to continue to a research degree in English language or linguistics; students who obtain good results in their MA examinations may be considered for the MPhil/PhD programme at UCL (subject to places being available). Graduates may also become teachers or lecturers of English, or pursue a career in writing, publishing, or editing.</p></p>      <div class="clearfix">
                  <div class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
            <h4>Top career destinations for this degree</h4>
            <ul>
                              <li>
                                      <span >Secondary School Teacher (English Language), Unspecified Middle School, China</span>                                  </li>
                            <li>
                                      <span >TEFL (Teaching English as a Foreign Language) and SAT Teacher, Unspecified Teaching Company</span>                                  </li>
                            <li>
                                      <span >English Teacher, Institute of English</span>                                  </li>
                            <li>
                                      <span >Editor, Self-Employed Editor</span>                                  </li>
                        </ul>
          </div>
        
              </div>

      
              <div class="clearfix">
          <div class="copy__column">
            <p class="small text-muted">Careers data is taken from the ‘Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education’ survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2012–2014 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>          </div>
        </div>
          </div>
  </section>
  <!-- /tal:careers -->

  <!-- tal:reviewsandwhy -->
  <section class="copy__section copy__section--taught">
    <h2 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Why study this degree at UCL?</h2>
    <div class="collapse__content">
              <p><p>The department has exceptional resources for the study of English linguistics. Use of the Survey of English Usage has resulted in many important studies of the grammar, semantics and vocabulary of present-day English.</p></p>
              <p><p>Excellent library facilities are provided by the UCL Library, Senate House Library and the British Library.</p></p>
      
      
              <p><strong>Department:</strong> <a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/english" class="clicktracker department--why__ucl">English Language & Literature</a></p>
      
              <p>
          <strong>Student / staff numbers</strong>
                      &rsaquo; 33 staff
                          including 2 postdocs
                                            &rsaquo; 67 taught students
                                &rsaquo; 49 research students
                    <br />
          Staff/student numbers information correct as of 1 August 2017.        </p>
      
              <h4>Research Excellence Framework (REF)</h4>
                <p >The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework</a>, or REF, is the system for assessing the quality of research in UK higher education institutions. The 2014 REF was carried out by the UK's higher education funding bodies, and the results used to allocate research funding from 2015/16.</p>                  <p>The following REF score was awarded to the department: English Language & Literature<br />85% rated 4* (&#145;world-leading&#146;) or 3* (&#145;internationally excellent&#146;)</p>
                <p >Learn more about the scope of UCL's research, and browse case studies, on our <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/impact/">Research Impact website</a>.</p>      
              <h4>What our students and staff say</h4>
                  <div class="box--alt tagged">
            <div class="tag tag--taught"><span class="tag__heading">Staff view</span></div>

            <div class="media">
              <div class="media__body">
                <blockquote>
                  <p>&quot;London offers unparalleled resources for all researchers and UCL is fortunate in being just round the corner from the British Library, British Museum and the Wellcome Trust.&quot;</p>
                  <h3 class="as-h5">
                    <cite>Professor Bas Aarts</cite>
                  </h3>
                  <small>
                    English Linguistics MA                                      </small>
                  <br />
                  <small >Professor of English Linguistics</small>                </blockquote>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
                  </div>
  </section>
  <!-- /tal:reviewsandwhy -->

  <!-- tal:application -->
      <section class="copy__section copy__section--taught">
      <h2 id="application" class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h2>

      <div class="collapse__content">
        <h3>Applications</h3>

                  <p >Students are advised to apply as early as possible due to competition for places. Those applying for scholarship funding (particularly overseas applicants) should take note of application deadlines.</p>                
        
        <div class="clearfix">
          <div class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                          <h4>Who can apply?</h4>
              <p ><p>The programme is of interest to those who wish to continue to a research degree in English language or linguistics, those who wish to become teachers or lecturers of English, or those intending to pursue a career in writing, publishing, or editing.</p></p>                        <div>
              <h4>Application deadlines</h4>
                              <dl class="list--defined">
                                                            <dt >All applicants</dt>                      <dd >27 July 2018</dd>                                                                                                                                  </dl>
                                                                    </div>
            <br><p>For more information see our <a href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Applications</a> page.</p>
            <a class="clicktracker call-to-action applytaught" href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Apply now</a>
          </div>
                      <div class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
              <h4>What are we looking for?</h4>
              <p ><p>When we assess your application we would like to learn:</p><ul>

<li>why you want to study English Linguistics at graduate level</li> <li>why you want to study English Linguistics at UCL</li> <li>what particularly attracts you to this programme</li> <li>how your academic and/or professional background meets the demands of a challenging academic environment</li> <li>where you would like to go professionally with your degree</li>

</ul><p>Together with essential academic requirements, the personal statement is your opportunity to illustrate whether your reasons for applying to this programme match what the programme will deliver.</p></p>                          </div>
                  </div>
        <!-- contacts go here -->
                    <div class="clearfix">
                <h3>Contact information</h3>
                                                        <div class="copy__column dc1-dc2">

        <article class="item-block">
            <div class="item-block__content">
                <h3><a href="//ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/why-london/"
                       class="clicktracker lifeandlearning">Life in London</a></h3>
                <div>
                    <a href="//ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/why-london/">
                            <img src="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/skins/UCLProspectiveStudentsUGSkin/ug-theme/images/student-stories-button.png" alt="Student stories"></a>
                    <a href="//ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/why-london/"
                       class="clicktracker lifeandlearning pill pill-button">Find out more</a> 
            </div>
        </div></article>
    </div>

                        </section>

                        <div class="hero block--full-width"
                             style="background-image: url('//www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/images/hero/taught/june2014-305')">
                            <div class="hero__content">
                                <div class="hero__body hero__body--background">
                                    <!-- Start special PS intro --> 

    
        
            <h1 class="as-h5 hero__sub">
                <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/taught">Taught</a>
            </h1>
            
                
                    <h1 class="hero__title">English</h1>
                    <p class="hero__blurb">The department has specialists in every period of English and American literature, as well as English language, and offers a full programme of research colloquia &#150; at which papers are given by invited speakers and graduate students themselves &#150; research methods seminars, and career development workshops. Students from the department have participated as visiting scholars at Yale as part of the UCL-Yale Collaborative Partnership.  Students have automatic access to an incomparable range of archives and libraries, including Senate House Library and the British Library, both of which are nearby.</p>
                
            
            
        
    

    

    


<!-- End special PS intro --> 

                                </div>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </header>

        <div class="item-block__content item-block__content--push">

                              <a id="navigation" name="navigation"></a>
                              <!--Start Generate Menu-->
                              <h6 class="vlist">UCL Error Message</h6>
                              <ul class="vlist">
                                  <li class=""><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/" class="document-content">UCL Home</a></li>
                              </ul>
                              <!--End Generate Menu-->
                              <!--Start left include-->
                              <div id="left-silva-content" class="leftcontainer">
                              </div>
                              <!--End left include-->
                            </div>
                        </div>
                        <!-- end: #col1 -->
                        <!-- begin: #col2 second float column -->
                        <div id="col2">
                            <div id="col2_content" class="clearfix">
                                <div class="textsize"> 
                                  <!--div class="fontResizer">
                                    <a href="#" class="smallFont">A</a>
                                    <a href="#" class="medFont">A</a>
                                    <a href="#" class="largeFont">A</a>
                                  </div-->
                                </div>

                                <!--Start rightcontent-->
                                <div id="rightcontent" class="container"> 
                                    <!--insert index_right-->
                                    <div id="right-column">
                                    </div>
                                </div>
                                <!--End rightcontent-->
                            </div>
                        </div>
                        <!-- end: #col2 -->
                        <!-- begin: #col3 static column -->
                        <div id="col3">
                            <div id="col3_content" class="clearfix">
                                <a id="content" name="content"></a>
                                <!--Start center content area-->
                                <!-- start main slot where silva content gets rendered--> 
                                

                                
                                  <div class="info">
                                    <h2 class="heading">The resource cannot be found</h2>
                                    <p class="p">
                                      <acronym title="Uniform Resource Locator">URL</acronym>:
                                      http://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/english/current-students/undergraduate/criticism
                                      <br /><br />
                                    </p>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      Most likely causes:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>There might be a typing error in the address.</li>
                                          <li>If you clicked on a link, it may be out of date.</li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      What you can try:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>Retype the address.</li>
                                          <li>Use the search box above to find what you're looking for.</li>
                                          <li>Go to <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk" title="UCL Website">www.ucl.ac.uk</a> and look for the information you want.</li>
                                          <li><a href="javascript:history.back()" title="Back to previous page">Go back to the previous page.</a></li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      More information:
                                    </h4>
                                    <p class="p">
                                        This error (<acronym title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</acronym> 404 Not Found) means that you have connected to the UCL Website, but the page you wanted was not found. It's possible that the webpage is temporarily unavailable. Alternatively, the UCL Website might have changed or removed the webpage. 
                                    </p>
                                  </div>
                                

                                <!-- end main slot where silva content gets rendered--> 
                                <!--End center content area-->
                            </div>
                            <div id="ie_clearing">&nbsp;</div>
                            <!-- End: IE Column Clearing -->
                        </div>
                        <!-- end: #col3 -->
                  </div>
                </div>

                                    <h2 class="heading">The resource cannot be found</h2>
                                    <p class="p">
                                      <acronym title="Uniform Resource Locator">URL</acronym>:
                                      http://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/english/current-students/undergraduate/london-in-literature
                                      <br /><br />
                                    </p>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      Most likely causes:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>There might be a typing error in the address.</li>
                                          <li>If you clicked on a link, it may be out of date.</li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      What you can try:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>Retype the address.</li>
                                          <li>Use the search box above to find what you're looking for.</li>
                                          <li>Go to <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk" title="UCL Website">www.ucl.ac.uk</a> and look for the information you want.</li>
                                          <li><a href="javascript:history.back()" title="Back to previous page">Go back to the previous page.</a></li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      More information:
                                    </h4>
                                    <p class="p">
                                        This error (<acronym title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</acronym> 404 Not Found) means that you have connected to the UCL Website, but the page you wanted was not found. It's possible that the webpage is temporarily unavailable. Alternatively, the UCL Website might have changed or removed the webpage. 
                                    </p>
                                  </div>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Postgraduate</h1>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/postgraduate/documents/pg-timetable-autumn-2017">Postgraduate Timetable Autumn 2017</a></li>
<li><a href="/silva/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/Timetable_Spring-2018_MA_Provisional" target="_self">Postgraduate Timetable Spring 2018 (Provisional)<br /></a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/postgraduate/documents/MA_Handbook_2017-18" target="_self">Handbook:  MA Programmes</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/postgraduate/documents/Research_Degree_Handbook_2017-18" target="_self">Handbook:  MPhil/PhD</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">MA English:  Issues in Modern Culture</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/postgraduate/documents/Issues_ReadingList_2017-18" target="_self">MA Issues Reading List 2017-18</a></li>
</ul>
<ul class="disc">
</ul>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading">Shakespeare in his Time module offered as part of the MA Early Modern Studies:</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma" target="_self">MA Early Modern Studies</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/postgraduate/documents/shakespeare-iht-seminar-programme-2017">Shakespeare In His Time Seminar Schedule (15 credit module, 2017)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/postgraduate/documents/Shakespeare_in_his_time_reading-2018">Shakespeare In His Time Reading List 2018</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">General</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.grad.ucl.ac.uk/societies/english-department-society.html" target="_self">English Department Graduate Society</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/moveable-type" target="_self"><em>Moveable Type </em>Graduate Journal</a><em><br /></em></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ah/figs">The Faculty Institute for Graduate Studies</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/style_sheet_for_essays">Essay Style Sheet (Word)</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Research Seminar Series Programme</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/postgraduate/documents/research-seminar-series-autumn-2017">Research Seminar Series Autumn 2017<br /></a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Extenuating Circumstances</h2>





<p class="p">For the UCL Extenuating Circumstances Claim Form, see the<a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/srs/academic-manual/c4/annexes" target="_self"> annexes of Chapter 4 of the UCL Academic Manual</a>. In addition, it is important to read <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/srs/academic-manual/c4/extenuating-circumstances" target="_self">Chapter 4, Section 6.2 of the UCL Academic Manual </a>before completing the form. <br /> <br />Postgraduate students should hand completed claim forms, 
together with any evidence, to Clare Stainthorp in the English Department 
Office (within one week of the circumstance concerned).</p>

<h2 class="heading">Moodle</h2>





<p class="p">All relevant programme information will be available via <a href="https://moodle.ucl.ac.uk/login/" target="_blank">Moodle</a>. </p>

<h2 class="heading">See also</h2>





<p class="p">Some important UCL sources of information are listed below.</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/staff/term-dates/2016-2017" target="_self">UCL Term Dates</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.grad.ucl.ac.uk/" target="_self">UCL Doctoral School</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/support-pages" target="_blank">UCL Online Student Support</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/disability/" target="_blank">UCL Information for Students with a Disability</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/" target="_blank">UCL Information for Prospective Students</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international-students/" target="_blank">UCL Information for International Students</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/download" target="_self">UCL Postgraduate Prospectus</a></li>
</ul>

  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }

    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Undergraduates</h1>






<div id="accordion">

<dl class="accordion">
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">New Students</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/new-students" target="_self">UCL New Students website</a></li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Course Units</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p"> </p>
<p class="p"></p>
<p class="p"><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/course_units_17-18" target="_self">Information for full-degree undergraduate students of other UCL departments who wish to apply to take a course in the English Department</a> </p>
<p class="p"></p>
<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/images/foster-court-sign" width="240" height="160" alt="Foster Court Sign" class="medium-image" title="Foster Court Sign" /><p class="p"></p>
<p class="p"></p>
<p class="p"></p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Undergraduate Handbook 2017-18</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>

<h2 class="heading">English Department Undergraduate Handbook </h2>





<ul class="nobullet">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/undergraduate_handbook_17-18"><strong>Undergraduate Handbook 2017-18</strong></a><br />
</li>
</ul>
<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/observatory_snow" width="120" height="184" alt="Observatory in snow, UCL Main Quad" class="no-respond float-right" title="Observatory in snow, UCL Main Quad" />
</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">BASc students</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">First-year
UCL BASc students can take the designated half-unit ‘Introduction to English
Literature’ (ENGL1004) as part of the BASc ‘Cultures’ pathway. This is examined
by two final essays, but there are no additional tutorial essays to write (and
first-year BASc students are not part of the English Department personal tutor
system). </p>
<p class="p">Much
information about the course, and the assessment, is to be found on the course
Moodle page for ENGL1004. </p>
<p class="p">BASc
students who achieve a mark of 60 or more in each of the two assessed essays
for ENGL1004 can continue in subsequent years to take full-year courses (one or
more, depending on their degree structure) along side second-and final-year BA
English and Modern Language Plus students. </p>
<p class="p">Continuing
BASc students receive one tutorial per term with a personal tutor (in the
autumn and spring terms) for each of their English courses. One essay is
written for each tutorial; these are a requirement for the course, though
tutorial essay marks do not contribute to the final assessment for the course.
Second/Final Year BASc students will find information relevant to them in Part
1 of the <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/ug_handbook_english_16-17">Undergraduate Handbook</a>, and should also refer to
the ‘Guidance on Examinations 2016-17’ and ‘Style Sheet for Essays’ documents
in the appendices.</p>
<p class="p">BASc
students do not have the option of writing a Course Essay in the place of a
desk exam. </p>
<p class="p">The
English Department BASc Tutor (who convenes the ENGL1004 course) is Dr Victoria
Symons. </p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Timetables</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading">First Year Course </h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/1_yr_timetable-aut17" target="_self"><strong>Timetable for Autumn Term 2017</strong></a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Second and Third Year Courses</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><strong><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/2_3_yr_timetable-aut17" target="_self">Timetable for Autumn Term 2017</a><br /></strong></li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Punctuation Guide</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p"> This guide aims to explain the basic rules of punctuation, and to 
help undergraduates to avoid some of the most common errors. It is intended
 as a rapid reference tool and is by no means exhaustive. <br /></p>
<p class="p">For more 
detailed explanations students are advised to look at <strong><em>Fowler’s Modern English Usage</em></strong>.</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/punctuation-guide-with-excercises">punctuation-guide</a></li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Style Sheet</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/style_sheet_for_essays"> Download the Style Sheet for Essays<strong> </strong></a></li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Examinations and Long Essays</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">Please see the <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/accordion/handbooks">Undergraduate Handbook 2016-17</a> for important information about the examinations, including the departmental 'Guidance on Examinations 2016-17' (in Appendix 3).<br /></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/exam_descriptions_2017" target="_self">Examination Descriptions 2017</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/research-essay-cover-sheet-2016-17">Research Essay Cover Sheet 2016-17</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/course-essay-cover-sheet-2016-17">Course Essay Cover Sheet 2016-17</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/accordion/stylesheet">Style Sheet for Essays</a></li>
</ul>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/accordion/plagiarism-declaration-forms">Plagiarism declaration form</a></li>
</ul>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/library" target="_self">Examination past papers for 2nd and 3rd years </a><em>(Link to UCL Library)</em></li>
</ul>
<ul class="disc">
<li><strong>BA English first-year Sessional Examination past papers are available from the first-year course Moodle page<br /></strong>
</li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"> Extenuating Circumstances Form: 
</h2>





<p class="p"><strong> </strong>For the UCL Extenuating Circumstances Claim Form, see the<a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/srs/academic-manual/c4/annexes" target="_self"> annexes of Chapter 4 of the UCL Academic Manual</a>. In addition, it is important to read <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/srs/academic-manual/c4/extenuating-circumstances" target="_self">Chapter 4, Section 6.2 of the UCL Academic Manual </a>before completing the form. <br /></p>
<p class="p">Undergraduate students should hand completed claim forms, together with any evidence, to Anita Garfoot in the English Department Office (within one week of the circumstance concerned).<br /></p>

<h2 class="heading"> </h2>






<h2 class="heading">Examiners' Reports</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><span class="underline"><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/exam_reports_15-16">Second and Third Year examinations 2016</a> (<em>2017 exam reports will be available in November 2017</em>)<br /></span></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/2014-15-exam-reports">Second and Third Year examinations 2015</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/2013-14-exam-reports">Second and Third Year examinations 2014</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/sessional_exam_reports-16-17" target="_self">First Year Sessional examinations 2017</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/sessional-examiners-reports-2016">First Year Sessional examinations 2016</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/sessional-examiners-reports-2015">First Year Sessional examinations 2015</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/sessional-exam-reports-2014">First Year Sessional examinations 2014</a></li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Other Useful Links</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>

receive information about open days, applications, and more.</p>

   Register your interest

<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  

<h3 class="heading">UCL+</h3>





<p class="p">Register your interest in studying at the Faculty of Arts &amp; Humanities and 
receive information about open days, applications, and more.</p>
<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/register-your-interest"
    class="cta btn pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/register-your-interest'])">

   Register your interest

 </a>
</p>


</section>

<h3 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/moodle" target="_self">Current Students</a></h3>





<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/moodle" width="450" height="287" alt="Moodle" class="medium-image" title="Moodle" />

<footer class="footer wrapper"> 
    <div class="footer__inner clearfix">
        
            <article class="block block--col-1">
              <h2 class="as-h5">Undergraduate degrees</h2>
              
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/ba-english" target="_self">BA English</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/ba-english/modern-language-plus" target="_self">BA Modern Language Plus (English and a Modern Language)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/latin-and-english-ba" target="_self">BA Latin and English</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/greek-and-english-ba" target="_self">BA Greek and English</a></li>
</ul>


            </article>
        


        
            <article class="block block--col-2">
              <h2 class="as-h5">Postgraduate degrees</h2>
              
<ul class="disc">
<li> <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/ma-issues-in-modern-culture" target="_self">MA in English:  Issues in Modern Culture</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/ma-english-linguistics" target="_self">MA in English Linguistics</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/mars/degree" target="_self">MA Medieval and Renaissance Studies</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/prospective-students/early-modern-studies-ma" target="_self">MA Early Modern Studies</a></li>
</ul>


<h4 class="heading">Graduate programme</h4>




<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/mphil-eng-lang" target="_self">MPhil/PhD in English Language and Literature</a></li>
</ul>


            </article>
        


        
            <article class="block block--col-3">
              <h2 class="as-h5">Current and Incoming Students</h2>
              
<ul class="disc">
<li> <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate" target="_self">Undergraduate</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/postgraduate" target="_self">Postgraduate</a></li>
</ul>

            </article>

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Undergraduate Handbook 2017-18</h1>

<h2 class="heading">English Department Undergraduate Handbook </h2>





<ul class="nobullet">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/undergraduate_handbook_17-18"><strong>Undergraduate Handbook 2017-18</strong></a><br />
</li>
</ul>
<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/current-students/undergraduate/documents/observatory_snow" width="120" height="184" alt="Observatory in snow, UCL Main Quad" class="no-respond float-right" title="Observatory in snow, UCL Main Quad" />

<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     <div class="content-sidebar">
                                        <div class="site-content__sidebar">

<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  

<h3 class="heading">UCL+</h3>





<p class="p">Register your interest in studying at the Faculty of Arts &amp; Humanities and 
receive information about open days, applications, and more.</p>
<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/register-your-interest"
    class="cta btn pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/register-your-interest'])">

   Register your interest

 </a>
</p>


</section>

</div>


<h3 class="heading"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/moodle" target="_self">Current Students</a></h3>





<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/moodle" width="450" height="287" alt="Moodle" class="medium-image" title="Moodle" />
</div>

                    </div>
                </div>

    <div class="footer__inner clearfix">
        
            <article class="block block--col-1">
              <h2 class="as-h5">Undergraduate degrees</h2>
              
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/ba-english" target="_self">BA English</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/ba-english/modern-language-plus" target="_self">BA Modern Language Plus (English and a Modern Language)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/latin-and-english-ba" target="_self">BA Latin and English</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/greek-and-english-ba" target="_self">BA Greek and English</a></li>
</ul>


            </article>
        


        
            <article class="block block--col-2">
              <h2 class="as-h5">Postgraduate degrees</h2>
              
<ul class="disc">
<li> <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/ma-issues-in-modern-culture" target="_self">MA in English:  Issues in Modern Culture</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/ma-english-linguistics" target="_self">MA in English Linguistics</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/mars/degree" target="_self">MA Medieval and Renaissance Studies</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/prospective-students/early-modern-studies-ma" target="_self">MA Early Modern Studies</a></li>
</ul>

<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/english/prospective-students/mphil-eng-lang" target="_self">MPhil/PhD in English Language and Literature</a></li>
</ul>


            </article>

              <h2 class="as-h5">Current and Incoming Students</h2>

  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }

    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  

<h3 class="heading">UCL+</h3>





<p class="p">Register your interest in studying at the Faculty of Arts &amp; Humanities and 
receive information about open days, applications, and more.</p>
<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/register-your-interest"
    class="cta btn pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/register-your-interest'])">

   Register your interest

 </a>
</p>

              <h2 class="as-h5">Undergraduate degrees</h2>

  }
